trans-unit.source: Monitor your on-premises identity infrastructure in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Monitor your on-premises identity infrastructure in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: This is the Azure AD Connect Health page that describes what it is and why you would use it.
trans-unit.target: This is the Azure AD Connect Health page that describes what it is and why you would use it.

trans-unit.source: Monitor your on-premises identity infrastructure and synchronization services in the cloud
trans-unit.target: Monitor your on-premises identity infrastructure and synchronization services in the cloud

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health helps you monitor and gain insight into your on-premises identity infrastructure and the synchronization services available through Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health helps you monitor and gain insight into your on-premises identity infrastructure and the synchronization services available through Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: It offers you the ability to view alerts, performance, usage patterns, configuration settings, enables you to maintain a reliable connection to Office 365 and much more.
trans-unit.target: It offers you the ability to view alerts, performance, usage patterns, configuration settings, enables you to maintain a reliable connection to Office 365 and much more.

trans-unit.source: This is accomplished using an agent that is installed on the targeted servers.
trans-unit.target: This is accomplished using an agent that is installed on the targeted servers.

trans-unit.source: What is Azure AD Connect Health
trans-unit.target: What is Azure AD Connect Health

trans-unit.source: This information is all presented in the Azure AD Connect Health portal.
trans-unit.target: This information is all presented in the Azure AD Connect Health portal.

trans-unit.source: Using the Azure AD Connect Health portal you can view alerts, performance monitoring, and usage analytics.
trans-unit.target: Using the Azure AD Connect Health portal you can view alerts, performance monitoring, and usage analytics.

trans-unit.source: This information is presented all in one easy to use place so that you do not have to waste time digging for the information you need.
trans-unit.target: This information is presented all in one easy to use place so that you do not have to waste time digging for the information you need.

trans-unit.source: What is Azure AD Connect Health
trans-unit.target: What is Azure AD Connect Health

trans-unit.source: Future updates to Azure AD Connect Health will include additional monitoring and insight into other identity components and services such as Azure AD Connect Sync services.
trans-unit.target: Future updates to Azure AD Connect Health will include additional monitoring and insight into other identity components and services such as Azure AD Connect Sync services.

trans-unit.source: Thus providing you a single dash board through the lens of identity, enabling you to have an even more robust, healthy, and integrated environment that your users can take advantage of to increase their ability to get things done.
trans-unit.target: Thus providing you a single dash board through the lens of identity, enabling you to have an even more robust, healthy, and integrated environment that your users can take advantage of to increase their ability to get things done.

trans-unit.source: What is Azure AD Connect Health
trans-unit.target: What is Azure AD Connect Health

trans-unit.source: Why use Azure AD Connect Health
trans-unit.target: Why use Azure AD Connect Health

trans-unit.source: Integrating your on-premises directories with Azure AD makes your users more productive by providing a common identity for accessing both cloud and on-premises resources.
trans-unit.target: Integrating your on-premises directories with Azure AD makes your users more productive by providing a common identity for accessing both cloud and on-premises resources.

trans-unit.source: However, with this integration comes the challenges of ensuring that this environment is healthy so that users can reliably access resources both on-premises and in cloud from any device.
trans-unit.target: However, with this integration comes the challenges of ensuring that this environment is healthy so that users can reliably access resources both on-premises and in cloud from any device.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health provides an easy cloud based approach to monitor and gain insights into your on-premises identity infrastructure is used to access Office 365 or other Azure AD applications.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health provides an easy cloud based approach to monitor and gain insights into your on-premises identity infrastructure is used to access Office 365 or other Azure AD applications.

trans-unit.source: It is as simple as installing an agent on each of your on-premises identity servers.
trans-unit.target: It is as simple as installing an agent on each of your on-premises identity servers.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health for AD FS supports AD FS 2.0 in Windows Server 2008/2008 R2, AD FS in Windows Server 2012/2012R2.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health for AD FS supports AD FS 2.0 in Windows Server 2008/2008 R2, AD FS in Windows Server 2012/2012R2.

trans-unit.source: These also include any AD FS Proxy or Web Application Proxy servers that provide authentication support for extranet access.
trans-unit.target: These also include any AD FS Proxy or Web Application Proxy servers that provide authentication support for extranet access.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health for AD FS provides the following set of key capabilities:
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health for AD FS provides the following set of key capabilities:

trans-unit.source: View and take action on alerts for reliable access to AD FS protected applications including Azure AD
trans-unit.target: View and take action on alerts for reliable access to AD FS protected applications including Azure AD

trans-unit.source: Email notifications for critical alerts
trans-unit.target: Email notifications for critical alerts

trans-unit.source: View performance data to determine capacity planning
trans-unit.target: View performance data to determine capacity planning

trans-unit.source: Detailed views of your AD FS login patterns to determine anomalies or establish baselines for capacity planning
trans-unit.target: Detailed views of your AD FS login patterns to determine anomalies or establish baselines for capacity planning

trans-unit.source: The following video will provide an overview of Azure AD Connect Health:
trans-unit.target: The following video will provide an overview of Azure AD Connect Health:

trans-unit.source: Get started in the Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: Get started in the Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: To get started with Azure Active Directory Connect Health, follow the steps below.
trans-unit.target: To get started with Azure Active Directory Connect Health, follow the steps below.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Microsoft Azure portal.](https://portal.azure.com/)
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Microsoft Azure portal.](https://portal.azure.com/)

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory Connect Health can be access by going to Marketplace and searching for it or by selecting Marketplace, and selecting Security + Identity.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Connect Health can be access by going to Marketplace and searching for it or by selecting Marketplace, and selecting Security + Identity.

trans-unit.source: On the introductory blade (A blade is one piece of the overall view.
trans-unit.target: On the introductory blade (A blade is one piece of the overall view.

trans-unit.source: You can think of a blade as a window or fly out), click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: You can think of a blade as a window or fly out), click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: This will open another blade with your directory information.
trans-unit.target: This will open another blade with your directory information.

trans-unit.source: On directory blade, click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: On directory blade, click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: If you do not have an Azure Active Directory Premium License you will need one to use Azure AD Connect Health.
trans-unit.target: If you do not have an Azure Active Directory Premium License you will need one to use Azure AD Connect Health.

trans-unit.source: For information on Azure AD Premium see Getting started with Azure AD Premium.
trans-unit.target: For information on Azure AD Premium see Getting started with Azure AD Premium.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]Remember that before you see any data in your instance of Azure AD Connect Health, you will need to install the Azure AD Connect Health Agent on your targeted servers.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]Remember that before you see any data in your instance of Azure AD Connect Health, you will need to install the Azure AD Connect Health Agent on your targeted servers.

trans-unit.source: To download the Azure AD Connect Health Agent, from the first blade, select Quick Start and Get Tools.
trans-unit.target: To download the Azure AD Connect Health Agent, from the first blade, select Quick Start and Get Tools.

trans-unit.source: You can also download the agent directly using the [link](#download-the-agent) below.
trans-unit.target: You can also download the agent directly using the [link](#download-the-agent) below.

trans-unit.source: To use Azure Active Directory Connect Health do the following:
trans-unit.target: To use Azure Active Directory Connect Health do the following:

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD Connect Health Portal and Services
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD Connect Health Portal and Services

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD Connect Health portal allows you to view alerts, performance monitoring, and usage analytics.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD Connect Health portal allows you to view alerts, performance monitoring, and usage analytics.

trans-unit.source: Upon first accessing Azure AD Connect Health you will be presented with the first blade.
trans-unit.target: Upon first accessing Azure AD Connect Health you will be presented with the first blade.

trans-unit.source: You can think of a blade as a window.
trans-unit.target: You can think of a blade as a window.

trans-unit.source: The first blade you see shows Quick Start, Services and Configure.
trans-unit.target: The first blade you see shows Quick Start, Services and Configure.

trans-unit.source: Below the screenshot is a brief explanation of each of these.
trans-unit.target: Below the screenshot is a brief explanation of each of these.

trans-unit.source: The services section shows the active services and instances of those services that Azure AD Connect Health is monitoring.
trans-unit.target: The services section shows the active services and instances of those services that Azure AD Connect Health is monitoring.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health Portal
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health Portal

trans-unit.source: **Quick Start** – by selecting this you will open the Quick Start blade.
trans-unit.target: **Quick Start** – by selecting this you will open the Quick Start blade.

trans-unit.source: Here you will be able to download the Azure AD Connect Health agent by choosing Get Tools, access documentation, and provide feedback.
trans-unit.target: Here you will be able to download the Azure AD Connect Health agent by choosing Get Tools, access documentation, and provide feedback.

trans-unit.source: **Active Directory Federation Services** – this represents all of the AD FS services that Azure AD Connect Health is currently monitoring.
trans-unit.target: **Active Directory Federation Services** – this represents all of the AD FS services that Azure AD Connect Health is currently monitoring.

trans-unit.source: By selecting one of the instances, a blade will open with information about that services instance.
trans-unit.target: By selecting one of the instances, a blade will open with information about that services instance.

trans-unit.source: This information includes an overview, properties, alerts, monitoring, and usage analytics.
trans-unit.target: This information includes an overview, properties, alerts, monitoring, and usage analytics.

trans-unit.source: Configure – this allows you to turn the following on or off:
trans-unit.target: Configure – this allows you to turn the following on or off:

trans-unit.source: Auto update to automatically update the Azure AD Connect Health agent to the latest version - This means that you will be automatically updated to the latest version of the Azure AD Connect Health Agent when they become available.
trans-unit.target: Auto update to automatically update the Azure AD Connect Health agent to the latest version - This means that you will be automatically updated to the latest version of the Azure AD Connect Health Agent when they become available.

trans-unit.source: This is enabled by default.
trans-unit.target: This is enabled by default.

trans-unit.source: Allow Microsoft access to your Azure AD directory’s health data for troubleshooting purposes only - This means that if this is enabled, Microsoft will be able to see the same data that you are seeing.
trans-unit.target: Allow Microsoft access to your Azure AD directory’s health data for troubleshooting purposes only - This means that if this is enabled, Microsoft will be able to see the same data that you are seeing.

trans-unit.source: This can help with troubleshooting and assistance with issues.
trans-unit.target: This can help with troubleshooting and assistance with issues.

trans-unit.source: This is disabled by default.
trans-unit.target: This is disabled by default.

trans-unit.source: Requirements
trans-unit.target: Requirements

trans-unit.source: The following table is a list of requirements that must be met before you can get going with Azure AD Connect Health.
trans-unit.target: The following table is a list of requirements that must be met before you can get going with Azure AD Connect Health.

trans-unit.source: Requirement
trans-unit.target: Requirement

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Premium
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Premium

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health is an Azure AD Premium feature and requires Azure AD Premium.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health is an Azure AD Premium feature and requires Azure AD Premium.

trans-unit.source: For more information see [Getting started with Azure AD Premium](active-directory-get-started-premium.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information see [Getting started with Azure AD Premium](active-directory-get-started-premium.md).

trans-unit.source: To start a free 30 day trial see [Start a trial.](https://azure.microsoft.com/trial/get-started-active-directory/)
trans-unit.target: To start a free 30 day trial see [Start a trial.](https://azure.microsoft.com/trial/get-started-active-directory/)

trans-unit.source: You must be a global administrator of your Azure AD directory
trans-unit.target: You must be a global administrator of your Azure AD directory

trans-unit.source: By default, global administrators have access to the information that is provided by Azure AD Connect Health.
trans-unit.target: By default, global administrators have access to the information that is provided by Azure AD Connect Health.

trans-unit.source: If you are not a global administrator of your Azure AD directory, you will not be able to create a service instance of Azure AD Connect Health.
trans-unit.target: If you are not a global administrator of your Azure AD directory, you will not be able to create a service instance of Azure AD Connect Health.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that you are a global administrator.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that you are a global administrator.

trans-unit.source: For additional information see [Administering your Azure AD directory](active-directory-administer.md).
trans-unit.target: For additional information see [Administering your Azure AD directory](active-directory-administer.md).

trans-unit.source: **Important:** The account you use when installing the agents must be a work or organizational account and cannot be a Microsoft account.
trans-unit.target: **Important:** The account you use when installing the agents must be a work or organizational account and cannot be a Microsoft account.

trans-unit.source: For more information see [Sign up for Azure as an organization](sign-up-organization.md)
trans-unit.target: For more information see [Sign up for Azure as an organization](sign-up-organization.md)

trans-unit.source: For AD FS, AD FS auditing must be enabled to use Usage Analytics
trans-unit.target: For AD FS, AD FS auditing must be enabled to use Usage Analytics

trans-unit.source: If you plan on using Usage Analytics with AD FS, then AD FS auditing must be enabled.
trans-unit.target: If you plan on using Usage Analytics with AD FS, then AD FS auditing must be enabled.

trans-unit.source: See [Enable Auditing for AD FS.](active-directory-aadconnect-health-operations.md#enable-auditing-for-ad-fs)
trans-unit.target: See [Enable Auditing for AD FS.](active-directory-aadconnect-health-operations.md#enable-auditing-for-ad-fs)

trans-unit.source: Meet the Azure AD Connect Health Agent Requirements
trans-unit.target: Meet the Azure AD Connect Health Agent Requirements

trans-unit.source: See the table below for agent specific requirements.
trans-unit.target: See the table below for agent specific requirements.

trans-unit.source: The following table is a list of agent requirements that must be met before you can get going with Azure AD Connect Health.
trans-unit.target: The following table is a list of agent requirements that must be met before you can get going with Azure AD Connect Health.

trans-unit.source: Requirement
trans-unit.target: Requirement

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD Connect Health Agent installed on each targeted server
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD Connect Health Agent installed on each targeted server

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health requires that an agent be installed on targeted servers in order to provide the data that is viewed in the portal.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health requires that an agent be installed on targeted servers in order to provide the data that is viewed in the portal.

trans-unit.source: For example, in order to get data on your AD FS on-premises infrastructure, the agent must be installed on the AD FS servers.
trans-unit.target: For example, in order to get data on your AD FS on-premises infrastructure, the agent must be installed on the AD FS servers.

trans-unit.source: This includes AD FS Proxy servers and Web Application Proxy servers.
trans-unit.target: This includes AD FS Proxy servers and Web Application Proxy servers.

trans-unit.source: For information on installing the agent see the [Azure AD Connect Health Agent Installation](active-directory-aadconnect-health-agent-install.md).
trans-unit.target: For information on installing the agent see the [Azure AD Connect Health Agent Installation](active-directory-aadconnect-health-agent-install.md).

trans-unit.source: **Important:** The account you use when installing the agents must be a work or organizational account and cannot be a Microsoft account.
trans-unit.target: **Important:** The account you use when installing the agents must be a work or organizational account and cannot be a Microsoft account.

trans-unit.source: For more information see [Sign up for Azure as an organization](sign-up-organization.md)
trans-unit.target: For more information see [Sign up for Azure as an organization](sign-up-organization.md)

trans-unit.source: Outbound connectivity to the Azure service endpoints
trans-unit.target: Outbound connectivity to the Azure service endpoints

trans-unit.source: During installation and runtime, the agent requires connectivity to the Azure AD Connect Health service end points listed below.
trans-unit.target: During installation and runtime, the agent requires connectivity to the Azure AD Connect Health service end points listed below.

trans-unit.source: If you block outbound connectivity make sure that the following are added to the allowed list:
trans-unit.target: If you block outbound connectivity make sure that the following are added to the allowed list:

trans-unit.source: *.servicebus.windows.net - Port: 5671
trans-unit.target: *.servicebus.windows.net - Port: 5671

trans-unit.source: https://*.adhybridhealth.azure.com/
trans-unit.target: https://*.adhybridhealth.azure.com/

trans-unit.source: https://*.table.core.windows.net/
trans-unit.target: https://*.table.core.windows.net/

trans-unit.source: https://policykeyservice.dc.ad.msft.net/
trans-unit.target: https://policykeyservice.dc.ad.msft.net/

trans-unit.source: https://login.windows.net
trans-unit.target: https://login.windows.net

trans-unit.source: https://login.microsoftonline.com
trans-unit.target: https://login.microsoftonline.com

trans-unit.source: https://secure.aadcdn.microsoftonline-p.com
trans-unit.target: https://secure.aadcdn.microsoftonline-p.com

trans-unit.source: Firewall ports on the server running the agent.
trans-unit.target: Firewall ports on the server running the agent.

trans-unit.source: The agent requires the following firewall ports to be open in order for the agent to communicate with the Azure AD Health service endpoints.
trans-unit.target: The agent requires the following firewall ports to be open in order for the agent to communicate with the Azure AD Health service endpoints.

trans-unit.source: TCP/UDP port 80
trans-unit.target: TCP/UDP port 80

trans-unit.source: TCP/UDP port 443
trans-unit.target: TCP/UDP port 443

trans-unit.source: Allow the following websites if IE Enhanced Security is enabled
trans-unit.target: Allow the following websites if IE Enhanced Security is enabled

trans-unit.source: The following websites need to be allowed if IE Enhanced Security is enabled on the server that is going to have the agent installed.
trans-unit.target: The following websites need to be allowed if IE Enhanced Security is enabled on the server that is going to have the agent installed.

trans-unit.source: https://login.microsoftonline.com
trans-unit.target: https://login.microsoftonline.com

trans-unit.source: https://secure.aadcdn.microsoftonline-p.com
trans-unit.target: https://secure.aadcdn.microsoftonline-p.com

trans-unit.source: https://login.windows.net
trans-unit.target: https://login.windows.net

trans-unit.source: The federation server for your organization trusted by Azure Active Directory For example: https://sts.contoso.com
trans-unit.target: The federation server for your organization trusted by Azure Active Directory For example: https://sts.contoso.com

trans-unit.source: Download the Agent
trans-unit.target: Download the Agent

trans-unit.source: To get started using Azure AD Connect Health you can download the latest version of the agent here: [Download Azure AD Connect Health Agent.](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=518973) Ensure that you’ve added the service from Marketplace before installing the agents.
trans-unit.target: To get started using Azure AD Connect Health you can download the latest version of the agent here: [Download Azure AD Connect Health Agent.](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=518973) Ensure that you’ve added the service from Marketplace before installing the agents.
